fields.description: the current RiTa version
Returns true if 'input' is an abbreviation

returns.desc: true if 'input' is an abbreviation

fields.description: Returns true if sentence starts with a question word

returns.desc: true if 'sentence' starts with a question word

fields.description: Returns one of the following constants, depending on the runtime environment (RiTa.JAVA, RiTa.JS, RiTa.NODEJS)

returns.desc: Returns RiTa.JAVA, RiTa.JS, or RiTa.NODEJS, depending on the runtime environment

fields.description: Takes two consecutive words and returns true if 'currentWord' is the final word of a sentence (if true, 'nextWord' is generally the first word of the next sentence)

returns.desc: true if 'currentWord' is the final word of a sentence

fields.description: Returns true if sentence starts with a w-question word, eg (who,what,why,where,when,etc.)

returns.desc: true if sentence starts with a w-question word, eg (who,what,why,where,when,etc.)

fields.description: Returns a random item from an array (or Collection)

returns.desc: the item

fields.description:
Returns a randomly ordered array of unique integers from 0 to numElements.
The size of the array will be numElements.

returns.desc: unique integers from 0 to numElements-1

fields.description: Splits 'text' into sentences (according to PENN Treebank conventions)

parameters.desc: text the text to be split
regex (optional) the pattern to be used for word tokenization

returns.desc: array of sentences

fields.description: Strips all punctuation from the input string

returns.desc: result

fields.description: Trims punctuation from both ends the input string (does not trim whitespace or internal punctuation)

returns.desc: result

fields.description: Returns true if every character of 'text' is a punctuation character

Tokenizes the string (into words) according to Penn Treebank conventions
See: http://www.cis.upenn.edu/~treebank/tokenization.html

parameters.desc: regex (optional) the pattern to be used for tozenization

returns.desc: in which each element is a single token (or word)

fields.description: Removes blank space from either side of a string
Convenience method to get the distance between 2 points

returns.desc: the distance

fields.description: Returns a string containing all phonemes for the input text

returns.desc: e.g., 'dh-ax-d-ao-g-r-ae-n-f-ae-s-t'

fields.description: Uses the default PosTagger to tag the input with tags from the PENN tag set

parameters.desc: if true, use WordNet syle tags (optional, default=false)

fields.description:
Takes an string returns a combined string of the form:

'The/dt doctor/nn treated/vbd dogs/nns'
, using lowercased tags from the PENN tag set

returns.desc: a combined string of words and pos tags

fields.description: Analyzes the input and returns a new string containing the stresses for each syllable of the input text

returns.desc: e.g., '01-0-1', with 1's meaning 'stressed', and 0's meaning 'unstressed',

fields.description: Analyzes the input and returns a String containing the phonemes for each syllable of each word of the input text,  delimited by dashes (phonemes) and spaces (words)

returns.desc: e.g., 'dh-ax d-ao-g r-ae-n f-ae-s-t' for the 4 syllables of the phrase 'The dog ran fast'

fields.description: Returns the # of words in the String according to the default tokenizer

returns.desc: the # of words

fields.description: Converts a PENN part-of-speech tag to the simplified WordNet scheme, consisting of the following 5 tags: 'n' (noun), 'v' (verb), 'a' (adj), 'r' (adverb), and '-'(other).

returns.desc: the simplified WordNet tag

fields.example:
// Java

Map args = new HashMap();
args.put("tense", RiTa.PAST_TENSE);
args.put("number", RiTa.SINGULAR);
args.put("person", RiTa.FIRST_PERSON);

String c = RiTa.conjugate("swim", args);


// Javascript

var args = {
tense: RiTa.PRESENT_TENSE,
number: RiTa.SINGULAR,
person: RiTa.THIRD_PERSON
};

var c = RiTa.conjugate('swim', args);
fields.description: Conjugates the 'verb' according to the specified options

parameters.desc: args containing the relevant options for the conjugator

returns.desc: the conjugated verb

fields.description: Returns the past participle form of the stemmed or non-stemmed 'verb'

returns.desc: the past participle form of the verb

fields.description: Returns the present participle form of the stemmed or non-stemmed 'verb'

returns.desc: the present participle form of the verb

fields.example:
String s = RiTa.stem('cakes');

String y = RiTa.stem('cakes', RiTa.PORTER);
fields.description:
Extracts base roots from a word according to the specified stemming algorithm
 
Note: see http://text-processing.com/demo/stem/ for comparison of Lancaster and Porter algorithms or http://mpii.de/yago-naga/javatools for info on PlingStemmer

parameters.desc: Choose RiTa.LANCASTER (the default), RiTa.PORTER, or RiTa.PLING, to specify the stemming algorithm to use

returns.desc: the stemmed form of 'word'

fields.description: Pluralizes a noun according to pluralization rules

returns.desc: the regular or irregular plural form of the noun

fields.description: Singularize a word according to singularization rules

returns.desc: the singular form of the noun

fields.description: Starts a timer that calls 'onRiTaEvent()', or the specified callback (in JS), every 'period' seconds

parameters.desc: the parent object in which to find (optional in JS)

callback function to be called every 'period' seconds
the function name String (in Java) or the function itself (in JS)

returns.desc: the unique id for the timer

fields.note: The 'parent' object is optional in JS, and the optional callback is a function, rather than a String name

fields.description: Stops a timer according to its unique id

parameters.desc: the unique id for the timer

fields.description: Pauses a timer according to its unique id

parameters.desc: the unique id for the timer

returns.desc: the new unique id for the timer

fields.description: Returns a random number between >= min (default=0) and < max (default=1)

returns.desc: the random number (its type depends on input parameters)

fields.note: if only one parameter is supplied, it is read as the max-value (with min=0)

fields.description: Loads the contents from one or more files/urls and then calls back to the supplied 'callback' function with the loaded string as an argument.

parameters.desc: the filename(s) from which to load the file

parameters.type: Function (optional: the callback, for JavaScript only) or Object (optional: the PApplet, for Java only)
parameters.desc:
If a Function (in JavaScript), it will be called after the file is loaded (with one string, the aggregate data, as its argument);
if no callback is supplied, or the argument is a PApplet(in Java), onRiTaEvent(re) will be called instead, with re.type() == RiTa.DATA_LOADED

fields.note: In Node, uses the node 'filesystem' or 'request' modules; in JavaScript, uses an invisible iframe; In Java, if a PApplet is passed as 2nd argument, it will be used to locate and check the 'data' folder of the sketch for the specified file

fields.description: For convenience, provides implementations of some of Processing built-in method, e.g. size(), background(), etc. and calls setup() and draw() automatically (if they exist)

parameters.desc: true to enable compatibility, else false

returns.desc: returns current value when no argument is given
